definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: So is it correct English to split infinitives?
sentences.chinese: 所以我的答案是可以拆分不定式。

sentences.english: Underline the infinitives in the following sentences and tell their functions.
sentences.chinese: 用橫線劃出下列句子中的不定式，並說出它們的作用。

sentences.english: Is it OK to split infinitives?
sentences.chinese: 把不定式分開是否恰當？

sentences.english: So, my answer is yes – it is OK to split infinitives.
sentences.chinese: 所以我的答案是可以拆分不定式。

sentences.english: An infinitive is a two-word form of a verb.
sentences.chinese: 一個不定式是由兩個詞構成的形式。

sentences.english: Voice is a property of clauses, and infinitives and gerunds form phrases.
sentences.chinese: 語態是從句的屬性，不定式和動名詞構成短語。

sentences.english: So is it correct English to split infinitives?
sentences.chinese: 那麼拆分不定式到底行不行得通呢？

sentences.english: There can be a difference in meaning when the infinitive or the gerund is used after some verbs.
sentences.chinese: 某些動詞後用不定式或動名詞時，意思有不同。

sentences.english: Sometimess we use question words+to-infinitives to replace object clauses.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們用疑問詞十動詞不定式來代替賓語從句。

sentences.english: Nouns, adjectives and infinitives can be used as objective complements.
sentences.chinese: 名詞，形容詞及不定式可用作補語。
分離不定式沒有語法問題。

sentences.english: How to use infinitive will be studied next week.
sentences.chinese: 如何使用不定式將在下週學習。

sentences.english: It is wrong to ever split an infinitive.
sentences.chinese: 將不定式分割永遠是錯誤的。
